```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
# The purpose of this rmd is to determine how many unique RT English stories I scraped.
```

```{r}
library(lubridate)
library(tidyverse)
```

```{r}
col_types = cols(
  date = col_character(),
  title = col_character(),
  content = col_character(),
  URL = col_character()
)
```

```{r}
data1 <- read_csv("clinton-civil-society/clinton-civil-society.csv", col_types = col_types)

data1 <- data1 %>%
  mutate(date = dmy(date))
```

```{r}
data2 <- read_csv("mcfaul/mcfaul.csv", col_types = col_types)

data2 <- data2 %>%
  mutate(date = dmy(date))
```


```{r}
data12 <- bind_rows(data1, data2)
```

```{r}
all_data <- bind_rows(data12345678, data9)
```

```{r}
u <- unique(all_data$URL)
# u is a character vector length 880; raw all_data length 1344.
```

```{r}
u_soros <- unique(all_soros$URL)

```

```{r}
# u_soros: 429; clinton: 116; mcfaul: 200; orange revolution: 162. The sums of these != u as there is some overlap between them (but not within them).
```
